Detailed Description

This file contains implementation of min RCP message handling.

Version:
0.1

Function Documentation

int ec_msg_ms_handler ( MsgBuffer *  message  ) 

Handler for ipc external controller message, used in master/slave scenarios (hence _ms_); since those in turn have several "subtypes", function reads type and calls apropriate handlers.

Parameters:
message MsgBUffer containing received IPC message
Returns:
result of the operation

Handler for sendreceive ipc message from slave

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error.

LOCAL int extif_msg_handle_reserve ( MinItemParser *  extif_message  ) 

Handles "response" message coming from external controller

Parameters:
extif_message pointer to item parser. It is assumed that mip_get_string was executed once for this parser to get first "word"
Returns:
result of operation, 0 if ok. Function handles external controller "reserve" message

extif_message pointer to item parser. It is assumed that mip_get_string was executed once for this parser to get first "word"

result of operation, 0 if ok.

LOCAL int handle_remote_cancel ( MinItemParser *  extif_message,
int  case_id 
)

Handling of "remote cancel" command.

Parameters:
extif_message - pointer to item parser containing received message. Assume that get_next_string was called several times, until "cancel" command was extracted
case_id - dev id extracted from external controller address field
Returns:
result of operation - 0 if ok.

LOCAL int handle_remote_pause ( MinItemParser *  extif_message,
int  case_id 
)

Handling of "remote pause" command.

Parameters:
extif_message - pointer to item parser containing received message. Assume that get_next_string was called several times, until "pause" command was extracted
case_id - dev id extracted from external controller address field
Returns:
result of operation - 0 if ok.

LOCAL int handle_remote_run ( MinItemParser *  extif_message  ) 

Handles RCP message containing "remote run" command.

Parameters:
extif_message - pointer to item parser containing received message. Assume that get_next_string was called several times, until "run" command was extracted - so next get_string will give first parameter to run keyword.
Returns:
result of operation - 0 if ok.

LOCAL int handle_remote_sendreceive ( MinItemParser *  extif_message,
int  dev_id 
)

Handles RCP message containing sendreceive command

Parameters:
extif_message RCP message
dev_id RCP device id. 0 on success, -1 on error.

int  execution_result,
int  test_result,
char *  desc 
)

Function that replaces "test case complete" callback, if min instance is used as slave.

Parameters:
run_id runtime id of test case (position in "selected cases" list)
execution_result indicates if starting of test case was successful
test_result result of test
desc description (taken from ipc message);

LOCAL int split_string_eq ( char *  input,
char **  name,
char **  var 
)

Function used to split string looking like name=value into 2 parts. It was necessary, because parser has only functionality to extract value only if name is known. Remember to deallocate "name" and "value" after they are not needed.

Parameters:
input [in] string to be split
name [out] points to string containing part before "=" sign
var [out] points to string containing part after "=" sign
Returns:
result of operation (0 if ok, -1 in case of problems); "name" and "value" will be NULL if splitting fails.

LOCAL int splithex ( char *  hex,
int *  dev_id,
int *  case_id 
)

Function splits RCP's adress string fields into two ints.

Parameters:
hex [in] string to be split, has to be 8 characters, otherwise function fails
dev_id [out] pointer to int that will hold device id
case_id [out] pointer to int that will hold case id
Returns:
result of operation, 0 if ok
Splits RCP's adress string fields into two ints.
Parameters:
hex [in] string to be split, has to be 8 characters, otherwise function fails
dev_id [out] pointer to int that will hold device id
case_id [out] pointer to int that will hold case id
Returns:
result of operation, 0 if ok

void tcp_master_report ( int  run_id,
int  execution_result,
int  test_result,
char *  desc 
)

Used in tcp/ip operation to report case result to master

Parameters:

execution_result indicates if starting of test case was successful
test_result result of test
desc description (taken from ipc message);

LOCAL char* writehex ( int  devid,
int  caseid 
)

Function writes text representation of slave adress, in hexadecimal with leading zeros

Parameters:
deviceid identifier of device
caseid id of testcase
Returns:
string containing proper representation, or INITPTR in case of problem.
